docs.lead_paragraph: An U.S. woman detained on the Indonesian resort island of Bali in connection with the murder of her mother has retained legal representation for her unborn child, the suspect's legal team said.

headline.main: Unborn Baby of U.S. Suspect in Bali Suitcase Murder Gets a Lawyer
headline.print_headline: Unborn Baby of U.S. Suspect in Bali Suitcase Murder Gets a Lawyer

docs.snippet: An U.S. woman detained on the Indonesian resort island of Bali in connection with the murder of her mother has retained legal representation for her unborn child, the suspect's legal team said.

docs.lead_paragraph: A houseful of immigrant women, three of whom work the same, numbing factory job, are at the center of “To the Bone,” a play by Lisa Ramirez at the Cherry Lane Theater.

headline.seo: ‘To the Bone,’ by Lisa Ramirez, About Immigrant Workers
headline.main: Soul-Stifling Jobs in the Land of Plenty
headline.print_headline: Soul-Stifling Jobs in the Land of Plenty

docs.abstract: Alexis Soloski reviews Lisa Ramirez play To the Bone, directed by Lisa Peterson as part of the Theater: Village festival at the Cherry Lane Theater.
docs.snippet: A houseful of immigrant women, three of whom work the same, numbing factory job, are at the center of “To the Bone,” a play by Lisa Ramirez at the Cherry Lane Theater.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is nothing resembling a national consensus on how to handle surrogacy and no federal law, leaving the states free to do as they wish.

headline.main: Surrogates and Couples Face a Maze of Laws, State by State
headline.print_headline: Surrogates and Couples Face a Maze of Laws, State by State

docs.abstract: Laws governing surrogacy agreements in the United States vary from state to state; Illinois law permits surrogacy with strict stipulations, and lawmakers in New York, Washington, DC, and elsewhere are considering similar measures (Series: Pregnancy For Pay).
docs.snippet: There is nothing resembling a national consensus on how to handle surrogacy and no federal law, leaving the states free to do as they wish.

headline.main: A Surrogate and a Mother: Partners in Pregnancy Share Their Story

docs.abstract: After cancer, Angela Salerni couldn’t bear a child — but she had frozen embryos. She needed a surrogate: Roshael Rose. It was a perfect match, but it still wasn’t easy.
docs.snippet: After cancer, Angela Salerni couldn’t bear a child — but she had frozen embryos. She needed a surrogate: Roshael Rose. It was a perfect match, but it still wasn’t easy.

byline.original: By ROSHAEL ROSE and ANGELA SALERNI, AS TOLD TO KJDELL'ANTONIA

docs.lead_paragraph: A television show that featured the nearly two-decade-old killing of an Arizona teenager and her unborn baby helped lead to the arrest of her ex-boyfriend, police said Wednesday.

headline.main: TV Show Helps Spur Arrest in 1997 Arizona Killing
headline.print_headline: TV Show Helps Spur Arrest in 1997 Arizona Killing

docs.snippet: A television show that featured the nearly two-decade-old killing of an Arizona teenager and her unborn baby helped lead to the arrest of her ex-boyfriend, police said Wednesday.

headline.main: 20 Years After 'It's Perfectly Normal,' What's Changed?

docs.abstract: If you’re looking to start a conversation about sexuality with your child, “It’s Perfectly Normal,” with its science-based, rigorously researched approach, makes for solid footing on which to begin.
docs.snippet: If you’re looking to start a conversation about sexuality with your child, “It’s Perfectly Normal,” with its science-based, rigorously researched approach, makes for solid footing on which to begin.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reports by United Nations agencies showed that a goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind.

headline.main: Despite Declines, Child Mortality and Hunger Persist in Developing Nations, U.N. Reports
headline.print_headline: Despite Declines, Child Mortality and Hunger Persist in Developing Nations, U.N. Reports

docs.abstract: United Nations reports significant declines in rates of child mortality and hunger globally, but warns that trends are persisting in parts of Africa and South Asia despite major health care advances and better food production; observes that while goal of halving the number of hungry people by 2015 is still within reach, second goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind schedule.
docs.snippet: Reports by United Nations agencies showed that a goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind.

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and SOMINI SENGUPTA

docs.lead_paragraph: Russell Pearce, who had been a polarizing figure on the immigration issue, said he was quoting someone else in calling for birth control for those getting Medicaid.

headline.main: Arizona Republican Official Resigns After Remarks About Medicaid Recipients
headline.print_headline: Arizona Republican Official Resigns After Remarks About Medicaid Recipients

docs.abstract: Former Arizona State Sen Russell Pearce resigns as Arizona Republican Party's first vice chair amid criticism for remarks he made supporting mandatory birth control or sterilization for Medicaid recipients.
docs.snippet: Russell Pearce, who had been a polarizing figure on the immigration issue, said he was quoting someone else in calling for birth control for those getting Medicaid.

docs.lead_paragraph: Though enthusiasm for potential advances in disease and injury treatments often outstrips the science, thousands of clinical trials are now underway to figure out how to best use stem cells.

headline.seo: Stem Cells: Plenty of Hope, but Halting Progress
headline.main: The Trials of Stem Cell Therapy
headline.print_headline: The Trials of Stem Cell Therapy

docs.abstract: Experimental stem cell procedures, once talked about but not put into practice, are starting to be used in trial settings; as many as 4,500 clinical trials involving stem cells are under way in United States to treat patients with conditions such as heart disease, blindness, Parkinson's and spinal cord injury; enthusiasm for such procedures, however, sometimes outstrips supporting science.
docs.snippet: Though enthusiasm for potential advances in disease and injury treatments often outstrips the science, thousands of clinical trials are now underway to figure out how to best use stem cells.
